title: Managing Exam Stress
author: Teen Mental Health Org
content: Exams can be a significant source of stress for teenagers. Here are some effective strategies to manage exam stress: 1) Create a realistic study schedule, 2) Take regular breaks, 3) Practice mindfulness and deep breathing, 4) Maintain a healthy sleep schedule, 5) Talk to someone you trust about your feelings.

title: Dealing with Peer Pressure
author: Youth Support Network
content: Peer pressure can be challenging to navigate. Remember that it's okay to say no to things that make you uncomfortable. Build a strong support network of friends who respect your boundaries. Develop confidence in your own values and decisions. If you're feeling pressured, talk to a trusted adult or counselor.

title: Healthy Social Media Habits
author: Digital Wellbeing Institute
content: Social media can impact your mental health. Set time limits for usage, be mindful of comparison traps, curate your feed to include positive content, take regular digital detoxes, and remember that most people only share their highlights online, not their struggles.

title: Understanding Teenage Anxiety
author: Teen Psychology Center
content: Anxiety is common among teenagers. Symptoms can include racing thoughts, difficulty concentrating, restlessness, and physical symptoms like headaches or stomach aches. Coping strategies include regular exercise, adequate sleep, limiting caffeine, practicing relaxation techniques, and seeking professional help when needed.

title: Building Healthy Relationships
author: Teen Counseling Services
content: Healthy relationships are based on mutual respect, trust, and communication. Learn to recognize red flags in relationships, set appropriate boundaries, communicate your feelings clearly, and understand that it's okay to end relationships that are harmful to your wellbeing.
